title: Homepage
descEn: Changes the language settings to english
descDe: Changes the language settings to german
differentLayout: Different layout depending on the problem
displaySolution: Display of the solution / explanations of possible errors
conversion_dialog_description: A conversion is necessary. Do you want to proceed anyway?
no_model_dialog_description: You must select a model type! (in the input box at the top right)
description_lp:
The CPLEX LP format is used to represent linear optimization problems. It uses a line-based syntax to define the objective function and constraints. Example:

Maximize
  obj: 3 x + 2 y
Subject To
  c1: x + y <= 10
Bounds
  0 <= x
  0 <= y
End
description_mps:
MPS is a widely used file format for representing linear and integer optimization problems. It is column-oriented and consists of sections like ROWS, COLUMNS, and RHS. Example:

NAME  SimpleProblem
ROWS
 N  OBJ
 L  C1
COLUMNS
    x  OBJ  3
    x  C1   1
    y  OBJ  2
    y  C1   1
RHS
    RHS1 C1 10
BOUNDS
 UP BND1 x 10
 UP BND1 y 10
ENDATA

fileExport.title: Export Files
fileExport.description:
Choose the desired file format for export. 
(Export is only possible if the Problem was already solved)
fileExport.noValidLpObject: No valid LP object to create output

welcomePage.powerfulSolution: Powerful solutions for Simplex and other OR problems using GMPL, LP, and MPS formats
welcomePage.context: OR Solver is a group project developed as part of a dual study program. Our team of dedicated students has created this powerful tool to simplify the process of solving operations research problems.
welcomePage.academicContext: By combining academic knowledge with practical application, we've designed a solution that caters to both educational and professional needs in the field of operations research.
welcomePage.startSolv: Start solving your OR problems today with our easy-to-use platform.
welcomePage.ORTeamRights: 2024 OR Solver Team. All rights reserved.

welcomePage.features: Explore our key features that make problem-solving easier.
welcomePage.about: Learn more about our project and its academic context.
welcomePage.contact: Ready to start? Click here to begin solving problems!

solverPage.input: Here you can input your problem in various formats.
solverPage.result: The results of your solved problem will appear here.
solverPage.solv-conv: Let's move to the Converter Page to convert between different formats.

converterPage.input: Input your problem to convert between different formats.
converterPage.format: Select the source and target format for conversion.
converterPage.output: The converted result will appear here.
converterPage.last_pt2: Have fun and success solving problems in the future! :)

features.feat1Description: Support for GMPL, LP, and MPS problem formats
features.feat2Description: Efficient algorithms for quick problem resolution
features.feat3Description: User-friendly interface for problem input and solving

gmpl.missingSemilicon: declaration is not properly closed with a semicolon
gmpl.invalidIdentifier: Invalid identifier. Only alphanumeric characters and underscore are allowed, and it must start with a letter or underscore
gmpl.modelMustHaveObjective: Model must have an objective function (maximize or minimize)

lp.constraintMissingOperator: Constraint must include a comparison operator (<=, >=, or =)
lp.missingObjectiveFunction: LP file must include an objective function (minimize or maximize)

mps.invalidRowType: Invalid row type. Must be N, L, G, or E.
mps.missingNameSection: MPS file must start with a NAME section
mps.missingRowsSection: MPS file must include a ROWS section
mps.missingColumnsSection: MPS file must include a COLUMNS section
mps.missingRHSSection: MPS file must include an RHS section
mps.missingENDATA: MPS file must end with an ENDATA statement

cpt1.Text1: As part of the dual study program in Business Informatics at Osnabrück University of Applied Sciences, we were able to apply our expertise in the areas of Operations Research and the fundamentals of web development during the 5th semester.
cpt1.Text2: During the first four semesters, we were taught knowledge and skills that must be applied in a bundled manner in this project to achieve the project's goal.
cpt1.Text3: The project team is rather heterogeneous in its knowledge and skills, so different perspectives have led to a promising web application.

skills.technical: Ability to understand technical challenges and develop efficient solutions.
skills.leadership: Competence in leading teams, mentoring, and coordinating projects.
skills.business: Ability to recognize business requirements and strategically translate them into technological or operational solutions.

cpt3.text: To fulfill the required functions for the project, certain solver libraries had to be used. The licenses used by the libraries were also taken into account. The libraries use Apache 2.0, MIT, ISC, and GNU GPL licenses. Therefore, we are bound to publish this project under GNU GPL as well.

cpt4.text: We believe in the power of the open-source community. Much of our code is publicly accessible to promote collaboration and innovation. By disclosing our source code, we not only want to create transparency but also give other developers the opportunity to learn from our work and build upon it.
